p: Many phytochemical studies on Ajuga species were performed which led to the isolation of phytoecdysteroids ( 34, 35), clerodane and neoclerodane di terpenoids ( 36, 37), iridoids ( 38) as well as phenylethyl glycosides ( 39). Previously, we studied the essential oil obtained by hydrodistillation from the aerial parts of A. chamaecistus Ging. ssp. chamaecistus, collected from Fasham, 35 km east of Tehran, which contained Î²- pinene (15.0%) and linalool (14.5%) as major constituents ( 40).
